Inventory Accountant Job at Max Drive




        
    

        
        Max Drive - We are a team of passionate people and a leading technology-enabled company driven by a vision to solve the mobility challenges in Africa. We want to get people and goods to their destinations hitch-free. It is personal for us because we understand the frustration of epileptic transportation. We are making mobility safe, affordable, accessible, and sustainable through the deployment of high-performance technologies and operators.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Accountant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos

Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking an Inventory Accountant who will ensure accuracy and efficiency in all tasks, prepare and submit weekly and monthly reports to management when expected or requested, and also record and update every financial data promptly.


Responsibilities


	Accountable daily for inventory stock management across MAX
	Inventory management using systems such as Odoo,
	Engage cross-functionally to problem solve
	Record delivering high-performing inventory operations


Requirements


	Minimum of 5 years of experience with 2 years at a managerial level.
	Minimum of a BSc Degree /HND in Finance, Accounting, or any relevant field.
	MBA would be an added advantage.
	Strong interpersonal and communication (written and oral) skills.
	Excellent understanding of Inventory Control principles and practices.
	Proficient in Google Workspace and Odoo ERP.
	Good Math Skills, Critical and analytical thinking.
	Accuracy and Attention to detail.
	Confidentiality and Thoroughness.

Administrative Assistant Job at Taimako Community Development Initiative




        
    

        
        TCDI is one of the frontline National Non-governmental organizations with over a decade of experience in providing humanitarian and development services in Nigeria. It has partnered with numerous government agencies, National and International NGOs as well as UN Agencies in the design, planning, implementation, and supervision of programmes and activities aimed at improving the lives of rural and urban communities.
     

            
    



The organization has footprints across the focal states and has been engaging with communities through its network of field workers and volunteers. TCDI was established in 2008 and registered with the Federal Government of Nigeria under the Corporate Affairs Commission (C.A.C.), Abuja on 23rd May 2014 with registration number IT/69569 and other regulatory bodies in the focal states.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location: Sokoto
Reports To: Operations Manager / Office Manager

Purpose


	Provide essential administrative and clerical support to ensure efficient office operations and support TCDI’s program delivery.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage office correspondence, filing systems, and document retrieval.
	Schedule meetings and prepare agendas and minutes.
	Organize and maintain office inventory and supplies.
	Support HR-related tasks (staff record keeping, onboarding logistics).
	Assist with logistics for travel, events, and bookings.
	Ensure confidentiality of organizational and beneficiary information.


Qualifications & Experience


	Diploma or Degree in Business Administration or a relevant field.
	Minimum 2 years of experience in administrative support.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook).


Note


	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	Qualified female and persons with disabilities candidates are highly encouraged to apply.
	The selection process for this position is competitive. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Candidates short-listed based on their online applications will have to undergo a series of online tests and interviews that allow for the identification of the most qualified person in a transparent and meritocratic manner. At the end of the process, candidates will be invited to in-person training and the best candidates will be offered a position.
